greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n gives the numbers floor(n/k), k=1..n.
comment: Number of times k occurs as divisor of numbers not greater than n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 19 2004
Viewed as a partition, row n is the smallest partition that contains every partition of n in the usual ordering. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Mar 11 2006
Row sums = A006218. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 30 2007
A014668 = eigensequence of the triangle. A163313 = A010766 * A014668 (diagonalized) as an infinite lower triangular matrix). -  _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 30 2009
Viewed as partitions, all rows are self-conjugate. - _Matthew Vandermast_, Sep 10 2014
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=1..50 of triangle, flattened
formula: Triangle A010766 = A000012 * A051731 as infinite lower triangular matrices. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 30 2007
Equals A000012 * A051731 as infinite lower triangular matrices. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 14 2007
Let T(n,0)=n+1, then T(n,k)=(sum of the k preceding elements in the previous column) minus (sum of the k preceding elements in same column). [From _Mats Granvik_, _Gary W. Adamson_, Feb 20 2010]
T(n,k) = 1 + T(n-k,k) (where T(n-k,k) = 0 if n < 2*k). - _Robert Israel_, Sep 01 2014

T(n, k) = if n >= k then if k == 1 then 1 - Sum_{i=2..n} (A008683(i)*T(n, i)/i^s) else T(floor(n/k)) else 0, where s=0. If "s" is a complex number, then the first column becomes the Riemann zeta function. - _Mats Granvik_, Apr 27 2016
program: (PARI) T(n, k) = sum(i=1, n, (i % k) == 0); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 08 2017
xref: Cf. related sequences: A006218, A014668, A115725.
Rows of this triangle (with infinite trailing zeros):
